data.title: Tina Turner’s Children (All about Craig, Ike Jr., Michael and Ronnie)
data.meta_description: Tina Turner was a mom to four sons, two adopted and two biological. Here's everything about Tina Turner's children: Craig, Ike Jr., Michael and Ronnie.
data.text:
Tina Turner’s Children: Tina Turner was a mom to four sons, including two she adopted from previous relationships. Tina first became a mom at the age of 18.

Tina Turner was a famous singer and actress known as the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll. She was born on November 26, 1939, in Nutbush, Tennessee. Tina became famous in the 1960s and 1970s for her powerful voice and energetic performances. She started her career with her first husband, Ike Turner, and they formed the Ike & Tina Turner Revue. They had many hits, including “Proud Mary” and “River Deep – Mountain High.“

Tina, who died in May 2023 at the age of 83 after a “long illness,” had her first son, Raymond Craig, with Kings of Rhythm saxophonist Raymond Hill in August 1958. Raymond was later adopted by Tina’s first husband, Ike Turner Sr., and his name was changed to Craig Raymond Turner.

Tina also adopted Ike’s two sons, Ike Jr. and Michael, from his previous relationship with Lorraine Taylor. Tina and Ike had one child together, Ronnie Turner, born in October 1960.

In her 2018 memoir, My Love Story: Tina Turner, Tina talked about her ex-husband’s “brutality” and mentioned that the children heard their “endless fighting.”

Craig died by suicide in July 2018. Four years later, Ronnie died of colon cancer.

In this article, we are going discuss everything about Tina Turner’s children: Craig, Ike Jr., Michael and Ronnie.

Meet Tina Turner’s 4 Children

Tina Turner was a famous singer and mother to four sons. Her first son, Craig Raymond Turner, was born in August 1958 to Raymond Hill and was adopted by Ike Turner. Craig died by suicide in July 2018. Tina and Ike’s biological son, Ronnie Turner, was born in October 1960 and died of colon cancer in December 2022. Tina also adopted Ike Turner Jr. and Michael Turner from Ike’s previous relationship with Lorraine Taylor.

Here’s everything you would like to know about Tina Turner’s children.

Craig Raymond Turner

Craig Raymond Turner was born on August 29, 1958. He was the son of Tina Turner and saxophonist Raymond Hill. He was raised in Mississippi and later adopted by Ike Turner when he married Tina. Raymond Hill died in April 1996 from heart failure, and Ike Turner died in December 2007 from a cocaine overdose.

Craig was a sensitive person and struggled with his parents’ troubled marriage. This affected him deeply. By the time Tina left Ike in 1976, Craig had finished high school. He later served in the Navy and became a real estate agent.

On July 3, 2018, Craig tragically took his own life at the age of 59. Tina scattered his ashes off the California coast on July 19, 2018, showing her eternal love for him. Tina said that Craig had recently started a new job and was in a loving relationship, but he might have felt lonely.

Ike Turner Jr.

Ike Turner Jr. was born in 1958 to Ike Turner Sr. and Lorraine Taylor. He was adopted by Tina Turner at a young age and saw her as his mother. Tina raised him from the age of 2 and guided his musical interests, encouraging him to explore different instruments. Ike Jr. learned to play the piano, guitar, and bass.

At age 13, Ike Sr. took Ike Jr. out of school to tour and work in his recording studio. Ike Jr. later worked briefly as Tina’s sound engineer after she separated from Ike Sr., but his father disapproved.

Ike Jr. won a Grammy for best traditional blues album with his father and achieved success in producing and engineering albums. However, by 1985, he lost contact with Tina, expressing feelings of neglect. By 2018, he hadn’t spoken to her for over a decade.

In May 2023, Ike Jr. was arrested for crack cocaine possession and tampering with evidence, just 18 days before Tina’s passing.

Michael Turner

Michael Turner, who was born in 1959 to Ike Sr. and Lorraine Taylor, was adopted by Tina Turner following her separation from Ike in 1978.

After the divorce, Michael faced challenges. According to Ike Jr., who is close to his younger brother, Michael wished for their parents to reconcile, leading to emotional distress and hospitalization.

As an adult, Michael struggled with addiction. Despite knowing that Tina and Ike would support him if he reached out, he felt unable to do so, expressing his desire for independence.

In recent years, Michael has faced health issues, including strokes and seizures, leaving him reliant on a wheelchair. Ike Jr. provided updates in 2017 and 2018, mentioning Michael’s residence in a care facility in Southern California and his need for ongoing medical care, although Tina has not visited him personally, she has supported him financially.

Ronald “Ronnie” Turner

Ronald “Ronnie” Turner was the son of Ike and Tina Turner, born on October 27, 1960, in Los Angeles. He faced challenges with self-destructive behaviors and drug-related issues but eventually became independent. Ronnie pursued a music career, playing bass in Manufactured Funk and appearing in the 1993 biopic “What’s Love Got to Do with It.” He married Afida Turner in 2007 and had two children. Ronnie passed away from colon cancer on December 8, 2022, at age 62. Tina and Afida both expressed deep grief and love for him, with Afida planning to have a child using Ronnie’s preserved sperm.

Conclusion

Tina Turner’s journey as a mother to her four children—Craig, Ronnie, Ike Jr., and Michael—has been marked by both joyous moments and profound tragedies. Each child has navigated their own path, influenced by their upbringing amidst Turner’s tumultuous relationships and the challenges of fame. From Craig’s tragic passing to Ronnie’s battle with cancer, Ike Jr.’s estrangement, and Michael’s health struggles, the Turner family has endured significant hardships. Despite these challenges, Tina’s love for her children remains unwavering, as she continues to honor their memories and support their endeavors. Through their individual experiences and contributions, Tina Turner’s children have added depth to her remarkable life story, showcasing the resilience and complexity of familial bonds amidst the spotlight.
